meanings.sent1: Her egomania made it difficult for her to consider others' feelings.
meanings.sent2: His egomania was evident in the way he constantly talked about himself.
meanings.sent3: At the party, his egomania led him to believe everyone was there just to see him.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, egomania can be a dangerous trait.
meanings.sent5: The egomania of the celebrity was so extreme that he refused to speak to anyone below his status.

meanings.sent1: Her egomania was so intense that she spent hours admiring herself in the mirror.
meanings.sent2: His egomania was so extreme that he believed he was the most attractive person in the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat's constant grooming could almost be mistaken for egomania.
meanings.sent4: In the fairy tale, the evil queen's egomania led her to believe she was the fairest of them all.
meanings.sent5: The artist's egomania fueled his belief that his self-portrait was a masterpiece.
